 ioctl cmd set
#define BEEP_IOCG   _IOR(BEEP_IOC_MAGIC, 2, int)
 ioctl cmd get
#define BEEP_BEEP   _IO(BEEP_IOC_MAGIC, 3)
 ioctl cmd beep

Function Documentation

int open ( const char *  path,
int  flags 
)

open device

Parameters:
path device node. 
        path＝“/dev/beeper”
flags open mode. 
        flags＝O_RDWR
Returns:
file descriptor if OK, -1 on error

int close ( int  fd  ) 

close device

Parameters:
fd The file descriptor returned by open
Returns:
Returns: 0 if OK, -1 on error

int ioctl ( int  fd,
int  request,
…   
)

control device

Parameters:
fd The file descriptor returned by open
request 
  • BEEP_IOCS　　　set beep param
  • BEEP_IOCG　　　get beep param
  • BEEP_BEEP　　　Buzzer rang with current parameters 
    //set beep param
        BEEP_PARAM parma;
        result = ioctl(fd, BEEP_IOCS, &param)

//get beep param
        BEEP_PARAM parma;
        result = ioctl(fd, BEEP_IOCG, &b_param);

//Buzzer ring
        result = ioctl(fd, BEEP_BEEP, 0);
Returns:
-1 on error, something else if OK

ssize_t write ( int  fd,
const void *  buf,
size_t  nbytes 
)

write data to the device

Parameters:
fd file descriptor returned by open
buf a poninter to buffer which contain buzzer's frequency and continuous time length. 
        the buffer according to the following format 
                \e[10;freq]\e[11;duration]\x7
        freq: frequency
        duration: continuous time length.
nbytes number of bytes to be written
Returns:
number of bytes written if OK, -1 on error
